content.title: Total Health Check-up Scheme (GBOCWWB)
content.department: Labour, Skill Development & Employment Department, Government of Gujarat
content.details: The “Total Health Check-up Scheme” is implemented by the Gujarat Building and Other Construction Worker’s Welfare Board (GBOCWWB). This scheme facilitates a complete physical examination of the construction workers, which can diagnose potential illnesses and early treatment can prevent major illnesses. Hence, major illness can be avoided and the construction worker can lead a healthy life.
benefits: Preventive health check-ups for workers, with a view to initiate proper treatment/health restoration measures.
Regular health check-ups recommended for every individual for diagnosis of any disease at its initial stage.
Includes routine doctors, pathology, radiology and cardiology check-ups with a limit of ₹1950/- per beneficiary paid to the empanelled hospital/institution.
eligibility: Construction workers who are registered with the Gujarat Building and Other Construction Worker’s Welfare Board.
documents_required: Proof of age (Birth certificate/Driving Licence/PAN Card/Voter ID Card)

faqs.question: What is the aim of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme aims to facilitate early detection and treatment of illnesses among construction workers.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The benefits include preventive health check-ups for workers, early diagnosis of diseases, and initiation of proper treatment or health restoration measures.

faqs.question: How often are health check-ups recommended under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Health check-ups are recommended regularly for every individual to diagnose any potential diseases at their initial stages.

faqs.question: What does the health check-up include?
faqs.answer: The health check-up includes routine doctor consultations, pathology tests, radiology examinations, and cardiology check-ups.

faqs.question: How much does the scheme cover for each beneficiary?
faqs.answer: The scheme covers up to ₹1950/- per beneficiary for the health check-up expenses at empanelled hospitals or institutions.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for the Scheme?
faqs.answer: Construction workers registered with the Gujarat Building and Other Construction Worker’s Welfare Board are eligible for this scheme.

faqs.question: Are there any specific terms and conditions for availing the benefits?
faqs.answer: Yes, beneficiaries must adhere to the spending limit of ₹1950/- and utilize Ayushman Bharat Yojana empanelled hospitals for check-ups and treatments.

faqs.question: Where can beneficiaries avail themselves of the scheme's benefits?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries can benefit from the scheme at empanelled institutions through camps held in various locations like construction sites or colonies.

faqs.question: How can an applicant apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicant may visit and apply through the Sanman Portal.
